Let $ x_1$, $ x_2$, $ \dots$, $ x_n$ be a sequence of integers such that\\
(i) $ -1 \le x_i \le 2$, for $ i = 1,2,3,\dots,n$;\\
(ii) $ x_1 + x_2 + \cdots + x_n = 19$; and\\
(iii) $ x_1^2 + x_2^2 + \cdots + x_n^2 = 99$.\\
Let $ m$ and $ M$ be the minimal and maximal possible values of $ x_1^3 + x_2^3 + \cdots + x_n^3$, respectively. Then $ \frac{M}{m} =$\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 3\qquad 
\textbf{(B)}\ 4\qquad 
\textbf{(C)}\ 5\qquad 
\textbf{(D)}\ 6\qquad 
\textbf{(E)}\ 7$
